page.title: 16MERSHAM HATCH ESTATE 2
page.content: The Estate Manager gave us his typical day:-"I get up at 0615 and visit the first dairy.Then it is into the Office to plan the day's work until breakfast time at 0830.After breakfast back to the Office to arrange meetings and deal with post until 1030. I visit the other two dairies and look over the young stock until lunch.Between 1530 and 1730 there are meetings and appointments. After that I deal with the arable side of the farm including more interviews until 1930.On the rounds of the farm I drive a Land Rover with radio contact to people in key positions.I sometimes miss being able to do some of the jobs such as ploughing or combining" There is a wide variety of crops grown. Cereals form the bulk of the income after milk.Crops include:Winter wheat, barley and oats;dried peas,vining peas and oil-seed rape as break crops:
